intro: Conyza amoena, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces small, blue to purple composite flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a fuzzy texture. Conyza amoena is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural and urban settings.
